Ukraine's Zelenskiy wants China to join global peace summitUkrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy wants China to take part in a global peace conference to resolve the conflict with Russia, he told a press conference on Monday. Mon, 15 Jan 2024 17:12:44 GMT MVD4YYSMPRLTBJG36QVOPTIONS https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-zelenskiy-wants-china-join-global-peace-summit-2024-01-15/Reuters世界欧洲
What to expect in 2024: Fed pivot, cooling inflation, easing growthGlobal growth will likely slow this year, but a dovish tilt in the Federal Reserve's stance has raised hopes for the U.S. economy and brightened the outlook for riskier assets, according to big banks. Mon, 15 Jan 2024 16:07:46 GMT 76SUVTOLZJPTPFQPBWEWR3KWBA https://www.reuters.com/markets/what-expect-2024-fed-pivot-cooling-inflation-easing-growth-2024-01-15/Reuters市场

Georgia's ruling party leader visits China in push for deeper tiesThe leader of Georgia's ruling party began a six-day visit to China on Monday, as the European Union candidate member country seeks to deepen its relations with Beijing, Georgian media reported. Mon, 15 Jan 2024 14:36:05 GMT KQQ7LD62MZLITIGCAGJJMBW3NQ https://www.reuters.com/world/china/georgias-ruling-party-leader-visits-china-push-deeper-ties-2024-01-15/Felix Light世界中国

China, Switzerland sign declaration with view to expanding tradeChina and Switzerland signed a joint declaration on Monday agreeing to deepen their partnership after Premier Li Qiang met the Swiss President, the Swiss government said. Reformist Arevalo assumes Guatemalan presidency after opposition delaysAnti-corruption crusader Bernardo Arevalo took office as Guatemala's president early on Monday after a chaotic inauguration caused by a last-minute attempt by opposition lawmakers to weaken his authority. Explainer: Houthi attacks expose China's commercial stakes in Red SeaChina has called for an end to attacks on civilian vessels in the Red Sea that have dramatically widened the Hamas-Israel conflict and placed Beijing's commercial interests along the Suez Canal at risk. North Korean hackers, criminals share money laundering networks in Southeast Asia - UNNorth Korean hackers are sharing money-laundering and underground banking networks with fraudsters and drug traffickers in Southeast Asia, according to a United Nations report published on Monday, with casinos and crypto exchanges emerging as key venues for organised crime. Explainer: Why the Maldives wants Indian troops outThe new Maldives president set a deadline on Sunday of March 15 for its giant neighbour India to withdraw all its troops from the tiny Indian Ocean archipelago nation. Mon, 15 Jan 2024 09:24:07 GMT A3E5Y65IS5OKROGH5SYVVFDSPY https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/why-maldives-want-indian-troops-out-2024-01-15/Krishn Kaushik世界亚太地区
China growth seen slowing to 4.6% in 2024, raising heat on policymakersChina's economic growth is likely to slow to 4.6% in 2024, and cool further to 4.5% in 2025, a Reuters poll showed, raising the heat on policymakers to roll out more stimulus measures amid deflationary pressures and a severe property slump. Mon, 15 Jan 2024 07:26:01 GMT PVREDDYZYNJ3II2GPCIGFLHNY https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-growth-seen-slowing-46-2024-raise-heat-policymakers-2024-01-15/Kevin Yao世界中国
